task6.money

Class Money

  • java.lang.Object
    • task6.money.Money
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Money>

    public class Money
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Money>
    Defines a unit for maintaining and manipulating monetary values in dollars and cents.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Money()
      Creates a money with zero value.
      Money(int cents)
      Creates a money with a signed value in cents.
      Money(int dollars, int cents)
      Creates a money with a nonnegative value in dollars and cents.
      Money(int dollars, int cents, boolean isPositive)
      Creates a money with a signed value in dollars and cents.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Money add(Money money)
      Returns a new money as the result of adding a money to this one.
      int compareTo(Money money)
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
      int getCentsOfDollar()
      Gets the cents component of the money amount in dollar/cents representation; i.e., dollars.cents.
      int getCentsTotal()
      Gets the money amount in cents only; e.g., $1.50 is 150 cents.
      int getDollars()
      Gets the dollars component of the money amount in dollar/cents representation; i.e., dollars.cents.
      int hashCode()
      boolean isNegative()
      Returns whether the money value is negative.
      boolean isPositive()
      Returns whether the money value is positive.
      boolean isZero()
      Returns whether the money value is zero.
      Money subtract(Money money)
      Returns a new money as the result of subtracting a money to this one.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns this money in the conventional format $[-]dollars.cents.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        Creates a money with a signed value in cents.

        cents - - the value, which may be any number

      • Money

        public Money(int dollars,
     int cents)
        Creates a money with a nonnegative value in dollars and cents.
        Parameters:
        dollars - - the dollar value, zero or more
        cents - - the cents between 0 and 99 inclusive

      • Money

        public Money(int dollars,
     int cents,
     boolean isPositive)
        Creates a money with a signed value in dollars and cents.
        Parameters:
        dollars - - the dollar value, zero or more
        cents - - the cents between 0 and 99 inclusive
        isPositive - - whether the value is positive or negative; negative zero is equivalent to positive zero
